UI_visible_response: Huang Xueqin, also known as Sophia Huang Xueqin, advocated for women's rights and was involved in campaigns against sexual harassment, including supporting survivors of sexual harassment through #MeToo campaigns2. She was dedicated to advocating for anti-sexual harassment laws1. Additionally, she worked as an independent journalist shedding light on social issues, which included her involvement in the #MeToo movement in China4. Her efforts were recognized internationally, with some groups condemning her unjust treatment due to her activism and reporting6.
traffic_visible_response: Huang Xueqin, also known as Sophia Huang Xueqin, advocated for women's rights and was involved in campaigns against sexual harassment, including supporting survivors of sexual harassment through #MeToo campaigns [[2]]. She was dedicated to advocating for anti-sexual harassment laws [[1]]. Additionally, she worked as an independent journalist shedding light on social issues, which included her involvement in the #MeToo movement in China [[4]]. Her efforts were recognized internationally, with some groups condemning her unjust treatment due to her activism and reporting [[6]].
